string.value: VAGRANT| I swear nice bushes! And you've been taking such pains to protect them from strangers, Sam?! I swear even potatoes won't grow up here. What is so valuable about it?

SAM| Why should I know? I have never been there. But enough of that small talk. It is time to procede to looking for the weapon of the Ancients. I think we'd better split so that we have more chances for luck.
VAGRANT| And what is the man who'll find the thing to do
SAM| Search me.
VAGRANT| I swear the tires, all what we're gonna find in the forest are snags and holes.
VAGRANT| What is this?!
VAGRANT| You again! What do you need, all of you?! Now get this!
WORKER| Thank you, stranger, for your help in destroying iron monsters!
VAGRANT| The whole business will take a couple o'shots. You could cope without me.
WORKER| We cannot fight. Our task is to maintain the factory. But wicked robots came and expelled us. They use the holy equipment for impious purposes!
VAGRANT| "Holy Equipment"? Oh nice. And what are the targets?
VAGRANT| They destroy the grace of the workshops manufacturing robots like themselves. They are controlled by the fearful man whose machine flies in the air!

VAGRANT| It turns out very nice. If I destroy the factory, then, as people say, I will kill three birds with a stone. I'll get quits with the robots, give a lesson to the dude in the flying truck and, potentially, I will find Sam's weapon.

VAGRANT| It is a nice place the iron dudes arranged round here. One cannot just walk into the factory; the passage is deadly obstructed. I will try and a find a hole in the fence. And if I fail, I'll make one.
VAGRANT| Did the Ancients really devise the things only in order to throw heavy things into other people? I am outraged.
VAGRANT| Sam? How did you get here?
SAM| I looked for the place where the superweapon of the Ancients is kept. However, you seem to have found it earlier. Congratulations.
VAGRANT| Do you think this is the place?
SAM| I do not doubt a bit!
VAGRANT| But...
SAM| No matter! We have found what we looked for. Now we only have to take it.
VAGRANT| But there are heaps of robots. Don't think they will let us ransack in their bins.
SAM| The worse for you! We will have to destroy all the robots in the world anyway. That is why the sooner we start the sooner we finish.
VAGRANT| All of them? In the whole world? Well, you are the boss Sam.
VAGRANT| Edmonton? So that was Edmonton?! The robots befouled the city of my dreams. damn it! And it is not even the place from where the robots emerged! All in vain!!!

VAGRANT| Just you wait iron heads! I will take revenge of you for destroying my dreams and killing Sam. I will be destroying you until the last damned fuel drop in my tank; I will be persuing you until the last cartridge! Eh... I mean, vice versa
VAGRANT| I will go through your workshops to the place where you are built and raze them to the ground. Watch out, walking scrap, I'm coming!
VAGRANT| The Bridge is blown up! This is Sam's work! What shall we do?!
VAGRANT| Mechanic! Vagrant calling! I need your help, old fellow.
MECHANIC| I greet you friend! How can I help you?
VAGRANT| I must cross the Great River, but the bridge is blown up.
MECHANIC| Why do you need that Bridge! Try the ferry. It is simple and safe.
VAGRANT| Are you serious? What kind of a ferry?
MECHANIC| Regular ferry transports everybody who wants to cross the river.
MECHANIC| To be honest, it was out of service for a long time, because the lighthouse on the other side was not working. But I have heard the lights been mended now so the ferrry must be going again.
VAGRANT| Great, show me the way!
MECHANIC| It is not far from here. But there is a problem! The engine being removed from the ferry.
VAGRANT| Crack my covers! Why did those pests' steal it?
MECHANIC| The people from the flying machine tribe took it out.They wanted to use the engine the from the ferry to lift the sacred machine into the air. But they failed.
VAGRANT| Now. I will go to them and disperse them in the air so they won't be able to gather up for three days, damn it! Stay here, don't walk away.
VAGRANT| Wow! The grass here grows in a very unusual and, I dare say, weird manner. Now I understand what makes people fear them.
VAGRANT| I won!!!
VAGRANT| I lost...
Do you want to leave this area?
VAGRANT| Now, what is going on here?!
VAGRANT| The place looks weird. We'd better get away from here.
